intro: Tournefortia luzonica subsp. angustissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and moist woodlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
